monitor-mysql.name: Connections/ threads connected
monitor-mysql.description: Number of currently open connections

monitor-mysql.name: Connections/ threads running
monitor-mysql.description: Number of threads that are not sleeping

monitor-mysql.name: Connections/ aborted clients
monitor-mysql.description: Number of connection attempts (successful or not) to the MySQL server

monitor-mysql.name: Connections/ aborted connects
monitor-mysql.description: Maximum number of connections that have been in use simultaneously since the server started

monitor-mysql.name: Connections/ max used
monitor-mysql.description: Number of simultaneous client connections allowed. By default, this is 150, beginning with MySQL 5.1.15. (Previously, the default was 100.)

monitor-mysql.name: Connections/ max allowed
monitor-mysql.description: How many threads the server should cache for reuse. When a client disconnects, the client threads are put in the cache if there are fewer than thread_cache_size threads there. Requests for threads are satisfied by reusing threads taken from the cache if possible, and only when the cache is empty is a new thread created. This variable can be increased to improve performance if you have a lot of new connections. (Normally, this does not provide a notable performance improvement if you have a good thread implementation.)

monitor-mysql.name: IO Requests/ bytes received
monitor-mysql.description: Number of bytes received from all clients

monitor-mysql.name: IO Requests/ bytes sent
monitor-mysql.description: Number of bytes sent to all clients

monitor-mysql.name: Select Rates/ select full join
monitor-mysql.description: Number of joins that perform table scans because they do not use indexes. If this value is not 0, you should carefully check the indexes of your tables.

monitor-mysql.name: Select Rates/ select range check
monitor-mysql.description: Number of joins without keys that check for key usage after each row. If this is not 0, you should carefully check the indexes of your tables.

monitor-mysql.name: Read Rates/ handler read random
monitor-mysql.description: Number of requests to read a row based on a fixed position. This value is high if you are doing a lot of queries that require sorting of the result. You probably have a lot of queries that require MySQL to scan entire tables or you have joins that do not use keys properly.

monitor-mysql.name: Read Rates/ handler read random next
monitor-mysql.description: Number of requests to read the next row in the data file. This value is high if you are doing a lot of table scans. Generally this suggests that your tables are not properly indexed or that your queries are not written to take advantage of the indexes you have.

monitor-mysql.name: Key Rates/ key reads (disk)
monitor-mysql.description: Number of physical reads of a key block from disk. If Key_reads is large, then your key_buffer_size value is probably too small.

monitor-mysql.name: Key Rates/ key writes (disk)
monitor-mysql.description: Number of physical writes of a key block to disk

monitor-mysql.name: Commands Rates/ handler rollback
monitor-mysql.description: Number of requests for a storage engine to perform a rollback operation

monitor-mysql.name: Commands Rates/ handler savepoint rollback
monitor-mysql.description: Number of requests for a storage engine to roll back to a savepoint

monitor-mysql.name: Tables/ table locks waited
monitor-mysql.description: Number of times that a table lock could not be acquired immediately and a wait was needed. If this is high and you have performance problems, you should first optimize your queries, and then either split your table or tables or use replication.

monitor-mysql.name: Tables/ max heap table size
monitor-mysql.description: This variable sets the maximum size to which MEMORY tables are allowed to grow. The value of the variable is used to calculate MEMORY table MAX_ROWS values. Setting this variable has no effect on any existing MEMORY table, unless the table is re-created with a statement such as CREATE TABLE or altered with ALTER TABLE or TRUNCATE TABLE.

monitor-mysql.name: Memory/ % key buffer size
monitor-mysql.description: If a write to the binary log causes the current log file size to exceed the value of this variable, the server rotates the binary logs (closes the current file and opens the next one). You cannot set this variable to more than 1GB or to less than 4096 bytes. The default value is 1GB. A transaction is written in one chunk to the binary log, so it is never split between several binary logs.

monitor-mysql.name: Memory/ read buffer size
monitor-mysql.description: When reading rows in sorted order following a key-sorting operation, the rows are read through this buffer to avoid disk seeks. Setting the variable to a large value can improve ORDER BY performance by a lot. However, this is a buffer allocated for each client, so you should not set the global variable to a large value. Instead, change the session variable only from within those clients that need to run large queries.

monitor-mysql.name: Misc./ slow queries
monitor-mysql.description: Number of queries that have taken more than long_query_time seconds

monitor-mysql.name: Misc./ long query time
monitor-mysql.description: If a query takes longer than this many seconds, the server increments the Slow_queries status variable. If you are using the --log-slow-queries option, the query is logged to the slow query log file. This value is measured in real time, not CPU time, so a query that is under the threshold on a lightly loaded system may be above the threshold on a heavily loaded one. The minimum value is 1. The default is 10.

monitor-mysql.name: Misc./ slow launch threads
monitor-mysql.description: Number of threads that have taken more than slow_launch_time seconds to create

monitor-mysql.name: Misc./ sort merge passes
monitor-mysql.description: Number of merge passes that the sort algorithm has had to do. If this value is large, you should consider increasing the value of the sort_buffer_size system variable.

monitor-mysql.name: Misc./ not flushed delayed rows
monitor-mysql.description: Number of rows waiting to be written in INSERT DELAY queues

monitor-mysql.name: Description/ Database Version
monitor-mysql.description: Version of the MySQL database

threshold-comment.threshold-content: High number of aborted connections
Nombre élevé de connexions interrompues
High number of failed connections
Nombre élevé de connexions échouées
High number of joins without index
Nombre élevé de jointures sans index
High number of joins without index
Nombre élevé de jointures sans index
High number of table locks waited
Nombre élevé d'attentes de lock sur une table
High number of table locks waited
Nombre élevé d'attentes de lock sur une table
High usage of the buffer containing indexes blocks
Pourcentage élevé d'utilisation du buffer contenant les blocs d'indexes
High usage of the buffer containing indexes blocks
Pourcentage élevé d'utilisation du buffer contenant les blocs d'indexes
High number of queries that have taken more than long_query_time seconds to be executed
Nombre élevé de requêtes ayant pris plus de long_query_time secondes pour s'exécuter
High number of merge passes executed by sort algorithm
Nombre élevé de 'merges passes' faites par l'algorithme de tri
